intro: Chelonopsis souliei var. cashmerica, commonly known as the Cashmere Chelonopsis, is a rare and unique plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is a succulent species characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid conditions. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically during the summer months. Its leaves are usually reduced to spines, which help minimize water loss and protect against herbivores. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
